column137: 02/22/2009: On Tuesday,  in the Khan al-Khalili market in Cairo a bomb targeted a Cairo Bazaar on a street lined with cafes and restaurants.  The blast was an improvised explosive device that was set off by a washing machine timer and placed under a concrete bench, which was shattered by the explosion.  The bomb was reportedly made of gunpowder, rocks, and metal and was located near the Hussein mosque.  French students that were on a school trip had gathered near the site when the device detonated.  One French student was killed in the blast, and at least 25 other civilians were injured.  No claim of responsibility has been reported.
